item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign: Recluse Sets the Stage for FromSoftware's Rumored Magic Game
item.description:
Elden Ring Nightreign excels on several fronts, but class distinction and combat may be its strongest suits. Nightreign 's slew of unique Nightfarers facilitates dozens of hours of varied, engaging gameplay, as there's plenty of room for experimentation and progression along each character vector. Naturally, Elden Ring Nightreign 's combat is still built around the soulslike framework, but it has enough differences to feel exciting and novel.

One of the most experimental Nightfarers is Recluse, a magic-focused character who takes control of the elements for maximum devastation. Deceptively powerful, swift, and versatile, Recluse slings spells at enemies from afar, Hoovering up affinity residues to replenish FP and charge special attacks. Indeed, she is surprisingly fun to play as, and her combat design makes a strong case for more inventive magic systems in future FromSoftware games, like the long-rumored Spellbound . Sadly, news about Spellbound has died down, leading many to believe that the rumors lack credence, or that the project was otherwise scrapped or delayed. But regardless of whether Spellbound exists, Recluse is a great jumping-off point for deeper, more engaging magic within FromSoft's signature combat design.

How Elden Ring Nightreign Elevates Magic Use With Recluse

Recluse Addresses Many Shortcomings of FromSoftware's Magic Systems

While the actual act of casting spells is mostly the same with Recluse as it is in Elden Ring 's base game, her passive ability and character skill do a lot to change the moment-to-moment gameplay. The aforementioned affinity residues, for instance, remedy the ever-present frustration of running out of FP: it can be difficult to play as a mage in Elden Ring or Dark Souls without constantly topping up FP with a flask, which can be a dull and oppressively finite practice. By consuming affinity residues, Recluse players are able to circumvent this restriction in an active and engaging way. Instead of just giving players unlimited FP, Nightreign 's inclusion of affinity residues encourages aggression and quick-thinking, making the overall combat loop both more accessible and deeper.

Then there's Recluse's Magic Cocktail character skill: upon consuming three affinity residues, Recluse can unleash a special ability, but this ability will be different depending on which residues are consumed. For instance, three magic residues will summon magic wisps that deal damage, while three holy residues boost defenses. Mixing and matching different residues can lead to unexpected effects, which is fitting considering the intense focus characteristic of FromSoftware's magic users: by learning which affinity residue combos are best for a given situation, Nightreign players may feel like they are engaging in the same rigorous intellectual labor as Recluse herself. In other words, the unassuming depth of the Magic Cocktail skill further deepens Recluse's combat sandbox.

How a Magic-Focused FromSoftware Game Could Learn from Recluse's Mechanics

If FromSoftware ever does end up taking a crack at a magic-centric RPG down the road, then Recluse feels like the obvious intermediary, a stopgap between the traditional soulslike combat of Elden Ring and the magic-heavy gameplay of this theoretical future title. Such a game wouldn't need to—and arguably shouldn't—copy Recluse's combat design verbatim, but encouraging players to be similarly thoughtful and strategic would have obvious benefits. After all, mages are supposed to be intelligent and cunning, so their gameplay should be more complex than simply spamming an attack button and chugging FP flasks.

Managing FP, mana, or whatever other term FromSoft would use in a future title, while also ensuring a good blend of quick-thinking and long-term planning, could be crucial pillars of a future FromSoftware magic game. The foundation for these pillars has already been set with Elden Ring Nightreign 's Recluse; hopefully, FromSoftware continues to build them in a future title.

Join forces with other players to take on the creeping night and the dangers within featuring 3-player co-op.

Take command of uniquely skilled heroes, each possessing their own abilities and distinct flair.

While individually formidable, their skills create powerful synergies when they unite as a team.

Overcome a relentless environmental threat that sweeps through a land that changes between each game session and defeat the magnificent boss of that night!"

item.title: 10 Beginner Tips For Rune Factory: Guardians Of Azuma
item.description:
Summary

  • Regularly check the village request board for rewards and money.
  • Visit street traders for rare cooking recipe ingredients.
  • Use Drum Dance to grow crops faster and heal allies.

\When beginning life as an Earth Dancer in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , players may soon realize there is a lot to do and manage in Marvelous Inc.'s action RPG Life Sim. From restoring and managing the village to defeating monsters and improving relationships with villagers, it's all in a day's work, especially with much to develop and unlock as players progress through the main story and its numerous side activities.

Consequently, new and veteran Rune Factory players alike may be eager to know various beginner tips for Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma to help them get started and progress. With only so much time in a day, there are several tips and tricks to help newcomers get started and decide what to do first or what to prioritize as Village Chief.

10 Check And Complete The Village Request Board Regularly

Get Rewards, Money, And More

After a bit of time spent progressing through the main story, players soon unlock the village request board , which provides more Ela Plaque villager requests as time goes on. Before setting out on adventures beyond Spring Village, it's always best to remember to check the request board for any new Ela Plaque quests, as players can tick off many of these just by exploring and defeating specific monsters, killing two birds with one stone.

When returning, don't forget to check the quest board again to turn in any quests completed while out and about. These reward players with goodies such as gold (these quests are a great way to make money fast), crafting resources, cooking ingredients, and even things like building structures, to name a handful of examples.

9 Visit Street Traders And Traveling Peddlers

Access More Cooking Recipe Ingredients

There are numerous opportunities to unlock more cooking recipes in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , such as interacting with Frog Statues. However, although Iroha's Teahouse Shop gradually acquires more stock and recipes, it's likely players will come across meals that require specific cooking ingredients which could prove tricky to find. For instance, when making Honey Toast in The Sage of Sweets quest, players will need ingredients like Ice Cream and Honey.

While it's possible to come across some ingredients in random crates or baskets while exploring, it's typically always best to check first with Street Traders , like the one who appears by the entrance to Spring Village. While these vendors don't show up all the time and their inventories vary, they often stock a wider variety of ingredients and rare items, so it's best to stock up. Eventually, other types of traders appear, such as the Marine Market Traveling Peddler outside Spring Village.

8 Do The Drum Dance

Use The Drum Dance To Grow Crops Faster, Heal Allies, And More

The Sacred Drum is the first Sacred Treasure players unlock in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma. It's a handy tool capable of not just bringing trees back to life and healing allies in combat by using the Drum Dance, but also speeding up crop growth when farming. Once planted, players can quickly accelerate crop growth time with a quick bash of the drum over their farming tiles, which is often better than waiting for villagers to help. Speeding up crop growth is also ideal, as harvesting crops rewards XP, and selling crops is one of the best ways to make money.

As players level up the Drum Dance via the Sacred Treasure Skills Tree, they can also unlock more abilities for using the Drum Dance in combat by inflicting Earth-based attacks. Players can also use the Sacred Sword to harvest seeds from their crops instead of produce.

7 Activate Dragon Statues For Fast Travel

Save The Game And Travel Around The Map Faster

Dragon Statues in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma aren't just for saving the game; they are also fast travel spots. Once players perform the Dance of Bonds at a Dragon Statue, marked by the dragon icon on the map, they can use them as another way to save their game besides sleeping back at the Dragon Shrine. After reaching a certain point in the main quest, players can also fast-travel to Dragon Statues they've activated using the warp sub-menu from the game map at any time.

Dragon Statue icons aren't the only things on the map for players to look out for during their travels. Numerous other icons scattered throughout the map highlight key items or discoverables, such as Frog Statues and resource locations.

6 Learn How To Skip And Stop Time

Skip Ahead To Save Time And Pause Time

Some quests in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma take place at specific times of day, meaning players will often need to come back at a specific hour. If players get stuck for things to do or want to skip ahead, there is a handy way they can skip time in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma by choosing either the 'Wait till Noon' or 'Wait till Nighttime' option at the Dragon Shrine. Doing so saves waiting around, especially for players keen to complete the main story or progress as quickly as possible.

Opening the menu will also pause time, so players needn't worry about time moving ahead when going through things like the map, skill trees, or villager profiles, for instance. Time also stops when Village Build Mode is active using the Terra Tiller.

5 Talk To Characters Daily

Reap The Benefits Of Raising Villager Bond Levels And Gain Gift Hints

It takes time to build relationships and beat Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma's main story. Talking with characters daily not only helps raise the player's Bond level with them, but doing so can also give players special bonuses in combat, unlock more social interactions, and even grant the opportunity to take part in Bond quests and let specific characters join players on their adventures. Talking to characters can also help reveal more information about each one, including hints about what kinds of gifts they might like or dislike.

Gift giving in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma can be a bit of a potluck, so listening to character dialogue can be a way to get some clues about what to give other characters as gifts, such as on birthdays. Giving a character a liked gift grants a much greater Bond boost.

Once players discover a liked gift, liked items display a heart symbol next to them in the player's inventory when giving a gift, as well as display it in their character profile, which can make knowing what gift to give easier.

4 Remember To Check And Use The Shipping Shed

Level Up The Village And Boost Profits

To ensure village profits keep flowing, don't forget to sell stuff in the Shipping Shed or Bin located in the Spring Village development plot. Items players place in their Shipping Bin get sold at the end of each day, with the profits displayed on the end-of-day village report when players sleep at night after they view their total All-Purpose XP for the day from activities like walking, combat, harvesting, and more.

In addition to Shipping Income, Business Income, and Villager Expenses, the village report also summarizes daily population changes, overall villager happiness, and any penalties applied for things like not making an income or staying up late. Shipping things like crops can help players stay on top of their income, which will in turn help level up the village when the time arises, so it's worth checking and adding things to the Shipping Bin daily to boost profits.

3 Complete Villager Bond And Personal Quests

Progress Relationships, Unlock More Story Elements, And Earn More Rewards

While it takes time to romance characters in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma and raise Bond Levels with each villager, completing unlocked Bond Quests from villagers is also worthwhile to help progress relationships with them. Bond quests also reward story content for each character, so players can get to know them even more and experience more of each character's personal story.

Completing a character's Personal Quests also rewards XP. It is another way for players to raise their Bond level with that character, and often gives various types of other rewards, such as gold, seeds, or other types of items.

2 Check Inventory Regularly And Know How To Restore Rune Points

Be Battle-Ready With Health And Rune Points

Before boss battles or more challenging enemy encounters, it's worth keeping tabs on a potentially overflowing inventory . When the player's inventory gets full, items automatically get transferred into storage. However, players can only use health items like meals to heal in battle from their inventory, so it's worth making sure the inventory itself is well-stocked with health-restoring items and checking for lost inventory items, especially if it becomes full.

It's also worth restoring Rune Points (RP) , so players can also use Sacred Treasures to their fullest in battle. While Rune Points gradually replenish over time, players can also restore Rune Points by interacting with Rune Lanterns, eating certain cooked meals, or resting.

1 Decorate The Village

Use Decorations To Increase Village Stats And Get Bonuses

In addition to developing villages with buildings to house villagers and produce handy cooking ingredients like Soy Sauce and Salt, it's also helpful to spend time decorating the village . Not only does adding decorations to development plots help make them look more visually attractive, but they can sometimes give players a special bonus for their village that increases its stats, such as a +1 Logging Bonus. Some decorations, like bridges and stairs, also help improve villagers' commute, making it easier for them to get around.

However, it's essential to note that some decorations only grant bonuses for specific villages, so choosing where to place them is crucial for maximizing the benefits.

item.title: Every Dungeons and Dragons Subclass For The Psion Confirmed So Far
item.description:
Dungeons and Dragons recently revealed an Unearthed Arcana that introduced the Psion – its first new class in over six years. This psychic spellcaster uses the power of their mind to alter the universe around them and control the battlefield. Though it is unclear which book this class will appear in, Dungeons and Dragons is planning to launch it with four subclasses: the Metamorph, Psi Warper, Psykinetic, and Telepath.

Each of these archetypes brings something new to the table, from the ability to reshape one’s body or warp creatures around the battlefield to further mastery of energy and mind manipulation. Interestingly enough, the subclasses from the new Dungeons and Dragons Psion class share a lot in common with some iconic Marvel characters, allowing players to easily replicate some of their favorite superheroes or villains from the X-Men , Fantastic Four , or elsewhere.

The Four Psion Subclasses in Dungeons and Dragons

Metamorph – Sculpt the Body Like Wolverine or Mister Fantastic

  • Level 3: Metamorph Spells, Organic Weapons, Extended Limbs
  • Level 6: Extra Attack, Quickened Healing
  • Level 10: Mutable Form
  • Level 14: Life-Bending Weapons

The Metamorph reshapes their body to suit their needs. They can turn their arms into weapons, extend their limbs, and alter their forms in unexpected ways. Quickened Healing and Life-Bending Weapons also give them the ability to heal themselves and others with their Psionic Energy.

Between his supernatural healing factor and adamantium claws, Marvel's Weapon X mutant Wolverine is evoked through abilities like Quickened Healing and Organic Weapons. However, Extended Limbs and Mutable Form also allows one to mimic some of the malleable powers used by characters like Mister Fantastic.

Psi Warper – Warp Around Like Nightcrawler or Doctor Strange

  • Level 3: Psi Warper Spells, Teleportation, Warp Propel
  • Level 6: Warp Space, Teleporter Combat
  • Level 10: Duplicitous Target
  • Level 14: Mass Teleportation

The Psi Warper controls the battle by warping space itself. They can empower spells like Misty Step and Shatter using their Psionic Energy, and improve the Telekinetic Propel feature of the base Psion class. At higher levels, they can swap places with allies to avoid hits, and can even reposition huge groups of allies or enemies on the battlefield.

The Psi Warper’s focus on teleportation is reminiscent of Nightcrawler, whose ability to move himself and others over short distances is in line with this Psion archetype’s abilities. Doctor Strange’s iconic portals in the Marvel universe work in similar ways, letting one learn the dimensional manipulations of the Sorcerer Supreme with this subclass just as easily.

Psykinetic – Control Matter Like Magneto or The Invisible Woman

  • Level 3: Psykinetic Spells, Telekinetic Techniques
  • Level 6: Empowered Attack Mode, Rebounding Field
  • Level 10: Enhanced Telekinetic Crush
  • Level 14: Heightened Telekinesis

The Psykinetic is the first of two Psion subclasses that focuses on doing what the new Dungeons and Dragons class does, but better. Featuring adaptable enhancements to Telekinetic Propel and Attack Mode, plus synergies with the Shield, Telekinetic Crush, and Telekinesis spells, the Psykinetic masters matter by using energy to create protective barriers and destructive force.

Though his powers are technically magnetism, Magneto’s iconic skillset could be replicated using the Psykinetic’s telekinesis, along with Empowered Attack Mode’s ability to hover. Likewise, Rebounding Field can help fans embody the powers of The Invisible Woman as seen in Marvel Rivals , with spells like Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere, Wall of Force, and Invisibility bringing the idea home.

Telepath – Master the Mind Like Professor X or Jean Gray

  • Level 3: Telepath Spells, Mind Infiltrator, Telepathic Hub
  • Level 6: Empowered Defense Mode, Potent Thoughts
  • Level 10: Telepathic Bolstering
  • Level 14: Scramble Minds

The fourth and final Psion subclass is the second that doubles down on the class’ core fantasy. The Telepath enhances Psion features like Telepathic Connection and Defense Mode, and grants benefits to spells like Detect Thoughts and Confusion when combined with Psionic Energy. These masters of the mind can also buff allies with telepathic aid, making them strong support characters.

As one of the most iconic Telepaths in fiction, all of this subclass’ abilities immediately call X-Men leader Professor X to mind. Telepathy is likewise one of Jean Grey’s most iconic abilities – though the overpowered X-Men hero would also likely have features from the Psykinetic as well.

item.title: Roblox: Basketball Zero Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Basketball Zero Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Basketball Zero
  • How to Get More Basketball Zero Codes

Basketball Zero is a fast-paced and simple in gameplay mechanics basketball simulator that can easily drag you into long hours of play. Also, between matches, you can spin for different Styles and Zones of play, and if you're lucky, get some cool skills that will help you during the game.

Actually, to succeed and get legendary or even mythical Styles or Zones, you will need to spend a lot of time getting Spins. To partially make it easier, just like in other Roblox games, in Basketball Zero , you can redeem codes that will bring you a lot of Spins and even Lucky Spins.

Updated June 7, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Basketball Zero currently has one active bonus you can claim, offering a helpful set of rewards to enhance your experience. It’s a solid opportunity if you're looking to get an edge during matches or unlock extra perks. More options could arrive later, so check back for updates.

All Basketball Zero Codes

Working Basketball Zero Codes

  • ACEREWORK - Redeem this code to get 7 Lucky Spins, and 7 Lucky Zones. (NEW)

Expired Basketball Zero Codes

  • CHROLLOBOREDRN - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • BOOSTEDCODE - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • BASKETBALLGOD - Redeem this code to get 8 Lucky Spins, and 8 Lucky Zones.
  • 3.5MLIKES - Redeem this code to get 8 Lucky Spins, and 8 Lucky Zones.
  • ACCIDENTS - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • STARREWORK - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • HISRRY - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • RANKEDCODE - Redeem this code to get 6 Lucky Style Spins.
  • chrollohi - Redeem this code to get Spins and Money.
  • PERFECTION - Redeem this code to get Spins and Money.
  • TATLISPATCHWOW - Redeem this code to get Spins and Money.
  • 2.5MLIKES - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 300KINTERESTED - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • CHROLLOGIFT - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 200KLOCK - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 150KLOCK - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 1.5MLIKES - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 10klikesyt - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • SUNDAYPATCH - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • YIPPEE3V3 - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 15KLIKESYT - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 150KINTERESTED2 - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • 10KLIKES - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • JACKPOT - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • SRRYFORCRASH - Redeem this code to get Spins.
  • JACKPOTTOMORROW - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • CHROLLOFORGOT - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • CHROLLOMVP - Redeem this code to get 3 Lucky Spins, 2 Lucky Zone Spins, 3 Zone Color Spins.
  • TATLISCODE - Redeem this code to get 2 Lucky Style Spins, 2 Lucky Zone Spins, 10k Money.
  • 150kevent - Redeem this code to get 3 Lucky Style Spins, 2 Zone Color Spins, 2 Trail Color Spins.
  • WOW100K - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • 1MLIKES - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • 400KWOW - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • 100KW - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • WCHROLLO - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • 500KLIKES - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • 350KLIKES - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • 150KLIKES - Redeem this code to get two Lucky Spins and two Lucky Zone.
  • 50KLIKES - Redeem this code to get two Lucky Spins and two Lucky Zone.
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get five Style Spins

Redeeming Basketball Zero codes is one of the few ways to get Spins, and it's a very effective one at that. So, don't miss this opportunity to get some freebies, because each code has a certain expiration date, after which it becomes invalid and offers no rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for Basketball Zero

Redeeming Basketball Zero codes is no more difficult than in most other Roblox games and will take you a few clicks. Here is also an informative and clear guide on how to redeem Basketball Zero codes and get rewards:

  • Launch Basketball Zero .
  • Pay attention to the bottom of the screen. There will be a bunch of buttons placed in a row. Among them, interact with the last one, which says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a green Redeem button. Now, in the input field, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned working codes.
  • Lastly, click on the green Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Basketball Zero Codes

To find more Roblox codes and, therefore, more rewards, you will need to visit and carefully monitor the main official Basketball Zero social media pages. The developers often share codes when the community reaches a goal of likes rated for the game, so just visit these pages from time to time to see the progress:

  • Official Basketball Zero Roblox group.
  • Official Basketball Zero Discord server.
  • Official Basketball Zero YouTube channel.

item.title: Roblox: Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes
  • How to Redeem Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes
  • How to Get More Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY is probably one of the most popular clicker simulators on the platform. Players only need to blow bubble gum and sell it to progress. But the better the gum you buy, the more effort it will take to blow it. Therefore, we recommend you take a look at the Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY codes.

As expected from Roblox codes, they contain various goodies from the developers. You can even find high-tier potions. However, players should hurry, as their validity period is limited.

Updated June 7, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY has a fresh code available that grants useful in-game rewards. This new drop can give you a helpful edge as you progress and unlock new items. Redeem it while it's active and make sure to use your items strategically. Stay tuned for more codes that could roll out soon.

All Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Working Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

  • update6 - Redeem this code to get Infinity 2 Elixir and 5 Mystery Box. (NEW)
  • update5 - Redeem this code to get Infinity 2 Elixir.
  • update4 - Redeem this code to get Infinity 2 Elixir and 5 Mystery Box.
  • update2 - Redeem this code to get 5 Mystery Boxes.
  • sylentlyssorry - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • update3 - Redeem this code to get Rewards.
  • easter - Redeem this code to get 4 Mystery Boxes.
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get a Mystery Box.
  • Lucky - Redeem this code to get Luck Potion V.

Expired Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

  • whoops - Redeem this code to get Infinity Elixir.
  • Throwback - Redeem this code to get 1 Infinity Elixir
  • Thanks - Redeem this code to get 2 Mystery Boxes

At the beginning of your adventure, you will blow bubble gum and buy new upgrades quite quickly. However, without additional multipliers, you will not achieve much. So, players should invest part of the earned money in hatching pets. As always, different eggs drop different pets, each of which has unique multipliers. And if you want to get all the rare animals in a short time, then Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY codes will help you with this.

Most of these Roblox codes grant players Mystery Boxes. When you open one, you will randomly receive different items, such as money, Gems, or even Potions. At the same time, some rare codes can offer you 5-tier potions. So you definitely do not want to miss them.

How to Redeem Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Using codes in Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY is no different from most other Roblox games. So, most players will have no problem with it. If this is your first gaming experience, then you just need to follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY .
  • Then, click on the Codes button on the left side of the screen.
  • After that, enter the code in the corresponding window.
  • Finally, click Redeem to claim free goodies.

How to Get More Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Now that you know how these Roblox codes can speed up your progress, you will want to know how not to miss new rewards from the developers. To do this, players must follow the developers' official social media pages. There you will find all the latest news first-hand:

  • Rumble Studios YouTube channel
  • Rumble Studios X page
  • Rumble Studios Discord server
